intro: Alopecurus aequalis var. amurensis, commonly known as Amur hairgrass, is a perennial grass species native to eastern Asia. It features slender, wiry stems and fine, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in width. The plant produces small, inconspicuous spikelets that are arranged in dense clusters along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along streambanks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of riparian and wetland ecosystems.
